title: 안느 에베르의 소설 속의 주변인들에 대한 연구
keywords: ['안느 에베르', '최초의 정원', '꿈이 가득한 아이', '번쩍이는 옷', '주변인', '주변화', '정체성', 'Anne Hébert', 'Le Premier jardin', 'L', 'enfant chargé de songes', 'Un habit de lumière', 'les marginaux', 'marginalisation', 'l', 'identité']
multilingual_abstract: Depuis Les Chambres de bois, son premier roman, jusqu'aux Fous de Bassan en passant par Kamouraska, Les Enfants du Sabbat et Héloise, Anne Hébert a représenté le refoulement, la violence, la folie, l'hypocrisie de ses personnages qui sont dans la plupart des cas des marginaux de la société.De là vient notre curiosité pour savoir ce qu'ils sont et ce que deviennent les personnages de ses derniers romans : Le Premier jardin (1988), L'enfant chargé de songes (1992) et Un habit de lumière (1998).. Cette étude a donc pour but d'analyser ces trois romans afin de saisir les messages que Anne Hébert nous communique à travers la marginalité de ses personnages.Les personnages des trois romans présentent deux aspects en commun. : ils deviennent tous marginaux en l'absence du milieu familial normal, et sont tous en quête d'une l'identité. Les trois romans mettent en scène des familles déficientes, sur les plans soit structurel, soit psychologique. Ces familles font l'objet de plusieurs problèmes : elles sont marquées par le manque d'amour, l'absence des parents servant à l'identification, le manque économique. C'est à partir de cette situation que les pesonnages des romans subissent une marginalisation qu'ils ne savent comment dépasser positivement.L'analyse des trois romans permet de résumer comme suit les derniers messages qu'Anne Hébert a laissés à travers ses personnages.Premièrement, la famille est à l'origine de la marginalisation de ses membres. Bien que dans ses trois romans la famille ne donne pas lieu de violence et à la cruauté, comme c'est le cas dans Le torrent ou Les Enfants du Sabbat, ces romans présentent le point commun de présenter leurs personnages comme étant marginalisés du fait de la famille dans laquelle ils évoluent. Il nous semble qu' Anne Hébert a mis en relief l'importance de la famille en tenant compte des problèmes québécois modernes qui ont été causés par la décomposition de la famille : violence familiale, accroissement du taux de divorces, des maladies mentales, des suicides, de la pauvreté, etc.Deuxièmement, la marginalisation née dans la famille a une influence négative sur la vie quotidienne et sociale. La plupart des personnages des romans pensent que leur vie est ailleurs. Ils ne parvennent pas à construire leur identité et s'épanouir. Flora substitue l'identité d'autrui à la sienne. Julien ne se contente jamais de son être dans le réel et plonge dans le rêve éternel. Quant à Miguel, il échoue dans l'établissement de sa nouvelle identité sexuelle et prend une décision de mourir. On trouve aussi une sorte de diabolisme dans les cas de Lydie et de Jean-Ephrem qui font du mal aux autres par pur plaisir.Troisièmement, à mesure que Flore remonte l'histoire du Québec, son caractère d'orpheline rejoint celui des canadiens français qui ont été abandonnés par la France, ce qui actualise les problèmes de la marginalisation et de l'identité pour le Québec et les Québécois. Touchant plus fort que jamais aux deux traumatismes québécois que constituent l'abandon de la part de la France et la Conquête anglaise, l'auteur semble demander aux Québécois, pionniers et vaincus, de rétablir leur identié.Quatrièmement, citant les anciennes québécoises victimes de la société dominée par les hommes et décrivant le martyre et la mort du petit Miguel homosexuel, Anne Hébert semble soulever les deux problèmes de l'égalité des sexes et de la libération sexuelle. Ce premier reste toujours à résoudre parce que l'inégalité des sexes subsiste au Québec malgré l'augmentation de l'entrée des femmes dans la société depuis la ‘Révolution tranquille’.

title: UNDERSTANDING CUSTOMERS’ USE AND INVESTMENT TRAJECTORIES IN ACCESS-BASED DIGITAL PLATFORMS
multilingual_abstract: Digital revenues from music and video have surpassed the physical revenues and, remarkably, access-based services are solely responsible for the growth of digital revenues, whereas (legal) downloading behavior and revenues from paying for ownership are declining (ERA, 2017; IFPI, 2017). However, access-based digital consumption business models are heavily dependent on customers’ continued use of their services. Through two studies, this research aims to investigate customers’ behavioral trajectories in digital entertainment services. Study 1 examines cross-lagged effects of non-financial personal investment on frequency of use and vice versa, while relating attitudinal and demographical antecedents to both trajectories. Study 2 investigates the moderating influence of financial investment on the relation between non-financial investment on frequency of use in a video streaming service with a freemium business model and studies at what point in time users decide to switch from a free service to a paid service. The results of the first study indicate that there are effects of the frequency of use of a service on the amount of non-financial investment put in the service (i.e. creating a list of favorites for later consumption), but the effects of non-financial investment on frequency of use are only found for women. Furthermore, in line with the self-service literature, perception of hedonic rewards is the strongest predictor of frequency of use and the amount of non-financial investment made in the service. For men, perceived ease of use is negatively related with the amount of non-financial investment made, indicating that men are less likely to see the added value of personal investment, when it is easy to find what they are looking for. Lastly, older people perceive new digital entertainment platforms as less hedonically rewarding, less easy to use and less useful, suggesting that they are more favorably disposed towards traditional forms of entertainment, such as the traditional TV. The results of the second study are still in progress and will be presented at the 2018 GMC conference.

title: Immunotherapy for Chronic Hepatitis B Virus Infection
multilingual_abstract: While new therapies for chronic hepatitis C virus infection have delivered remarkable cure rates, curative therapies for chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection remain a distant goal. Although current direct antiviral therapies are very efficient in controlling viral replication and limiting the progression to cirrhosis, these treatments require lifelong administration due to the frequent viral rebound upon treatment cessation, and immune modulation with interferon is only effective in a subgroup of patients. Specific immunotherapies can offer the possibility of eliminating or at least stably maintaining low levels of HBV replication under the control of a functional host antiviral response. Here, we review the development of immune cell therapy for HBV, highlighting the potential antiviral efficiency and potential toxicities in different groups of chronically infected HBV patients. We also discuss the chronic hepatitis B patient populations that best benefit from therapeutic immune interventions. (Gut Liver 2018;12:497-507)

title: Inflammatory mediators ATP and S100A12 activate the NLRP3 inflammasome to induce MUC5AC production in airway epithelial cells
multilingual_abstract:
Abstract

Danger-associated molecular patterns (DAMPs) play a proinflammatory role in the pathogenesis of airway obstructive diseases such as severe asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. The NLRP3 inflammasome is a cytosolic multiprotein platform that activates the caspase-1 pathway in response to inflammatory stimuli such as DAMPs. ATP and S100 proteins are newly identified DAMPs that accumulate in inflamed airways. We previously demonstrated that S100A8, S100A9, and S100A12 induce production and secretion of MUC5AC, a major mucin in the conducting airway mucosa. The purpose of this study was to determine the involvement of NLRP3 inflammasome in, and the contribution of ATP to, S100 protein-induced MUC5AC production by NCI-H292 mucoepidermoid carcinoma cells. Stimulation with either S100A12 or ATP led to MUC5AC production at comparable levels. Simultaneous treatment with both stimuli resulted in additive increases in NLRP3, active caspase-1, IL-1β, NLRP3/caspase-1 colocalization, and MUC5AC. NLRP3 siRNA or inhibitors of NF-κB, NLRP3 inflammasome oligomerization, or caspase-1 nearly completely inhibited ATP- and S100A12-mediated MUC5AC production. Furthermore, S100A12-as well as ATP-mediated MUC5AC production was almost equally blunted by both nonspecific and specific antagonists of the purinergic receptor P2X7, a principal receptor mediating NLRP3 inflammasome activation by ATP. Thus, these two danger signals contribute to MUC5AC production in airway epithelial cells through overlapping signaling pathways for NLRP3 inflammasome activation.

Highlights

  • S100A12 activates NLPR3 inflammasomes to induce MUC5AC production in epithelial cells.
  • ATP induces MUC5AC production in a mechanistically similar mode to S100A12.
  • S100A12-mediated MUC5AC production involves engagement of ATP.

title: Isolation of primitive mouse extraembryonic endoderm (pXEN) stem cell lines
multilingual_abstract:
Abstract

Mouse blastocysts contain the committed precursors of the extraembryonic endoderm (ExEn), which express the key transcription factor Oct4, depend on LIF/LIF-like factor-driven Jak/Stat signaling, and initially exhibit lineage plasticity. Previously described rat blastocyst-derived ExEn precursor-like cell lines (XENP cells/HypoSCs) also show these features, but equivalent mouse blastocyst-derived cell lines are lacking. We now present mouse blastocyst-derived cell lines, named primitive XEN (pXEN) cells, which share these and additional characteristics with the XENP cells/HypoSCs, but not with previously known mouse blastocyst-derived XEN cell lines. Otherwise, pXEN cells are highly similar to XEN cells by morphology, lineage-intrinsic differentiation potential, and multi-gene expression profile, although the pXEN cell profile correlates better with the blastocyst stage. Finally, we show that pXEN cells easily convert into XEN-like cells but not vice versa. The findings indicate that (i) pXEN cells are more representative than XEN cells of the blastocyst stage; (ii) mouse pXEN, rather than XEN, cells are homologs of rat XENP cells/HypoSCs, which we propose to call rat pXEN cells.

Highlights

  • We present novel mouse extraembryonic endoderm stem cell lines (pXEN cells).
  • pXEN cells show preimplantation-stage features not shown by XEN cells.
  • pXEN cells are easily converted into XEN-like cells but not vice versa.
  • pXEN cells are homologous to previously described rat XENP cells/HypoSCs.

title: Inflammatory potential of diet is associated with cognitive function in an older adult Korean population
multilingual_abstract:
Abstract

Objective

To examine the association between the inflammatory potential of diet and the quality of cognitive function in an older adult Korean population.

Methods

A total of 239 participants (88 men and 151 women) ages ≥65 y were selected from various health centers in Korea. To assess the inflammatory potential of diet, Energy-adjusted Dietary Inflammatory Index (E-DII) scores were computed based on a single 24-h recall. Cognitive function was assessed using the Korean Mini-Mental State Examination. Multiple linear and logistic regression models were fit to estimate the association between E-DII scores and the degree of cognitive function.

Results

E-DII scores were significantly inversely associated with Korean Mini-Mental State Examination score in both unadjusted and adjusted models, after controlling for sex, age, body mass index, sleep hours, supplement use, education level, self-reported health conditions, history of dementia, and physical activity (β = −1.33, 95% confidence interval [CI] = −1.95, −0.71, P < 0.0001; β = −0.58, 95% CI = −1.11, −0.06, P = 0.03, respectively). Participants in the highest E-DII tertile had increased risk for mild or moderate cognitive impairment compared with those in the lowest E-DII tertile (adjusted odds ratio 6.32, 95% CI 1.18–33.78; P for trend = 0.0031).

Conclusions

Higher E-DII scores were associated with increased risk of cognitive impairment, suggesting that consuming a proinflammatory diet is associated with increased risk for cognitive impairment in the older Korean adults.

Highlights

  • Higher Energy-adjusted Dietary Inflammatory Index (E-DII) scores are associated with increased risk of cognitive impairment, suggesting that consuming a proinflammatory diet is associated with increased risk for cognitive impairment in the older adult Korean population.
  • The older adult population who slept less than 7 h per day and consumed a proinflammatory diet had increased risks for mild or moderate cognitive impairment compared with those who consumed an antiinflammatory diet.
  • Recommendation of an antiinflammatory diet may be necessary to ensure cognitive health in this population.
  • Because cognitive impairment has been found to be an important predictor of dementia, establishing an antiinflammatory dietary recommendation for the Korean older adults may be a successful strategy to reduce the risk of cognitive impairment.

title: Erratum: “Chiral magnetoresistance in Pt/Co/Pt zigzag wires” [Appl. Phys. Lett. 110, 122401 (2017)]
